reviewText:
Grand Theft Auto V + Skate 3 + MadOut = This. I love it, even tho it is in beta.

I also found awesome glitch, that makes my car acceletate from 0 mph to 100 mph in around 3 seconds.

- Doesn't have a lot of cars.
- Doesn't have GTA V customization. ( You can't add bumpers, spoilers, rims, neons, upgrade power, etc. ) Atleast you can recolor the car and have a paintjob.
- No use for in-game money ( Atleast for me yet )
- No easter egg cars. ( Maybe xD )
- The cursor will be always on the screen, but you get used to it.
- You can't buy houses.
- Too high mouse sensitivity.
- My second car disappeared after saving.
- Got too hyped of Casino and Gun Store xP

Put boring pros here.

4/5

For some reason, my computer overheats" when I play this game. My computer shuts down if it feels like its overheating

reviewText:
I actually like this game, despite its massive flaws at this point in time.

The positives:
Alot of cars
decent destruction
open world exploring with races also
on foot free roam
customization of cars etc

The bad:
Not much content at the moment
animation is pretty poor
map design is very bad in places (floating items lack of textures)
Very glitchy (although very funny, the glitches are clearly an issue)
Stupid AI, they work like lemmings and fall off every cliff and roll their cars at every oppurtunity

Overall it needs more to do in the map or more maps, more cars and better customisation and overall polish but for the price it is pretty fun and super funny at times and for me i have personally got my moneys worth from it already and it isnt that far into development. Aslong as this game keeps updating it will be good soon.

Its also very slavic 7/10 cossack vodkas

reviewText:
While a very lacking beta, it is a very fun beta. It has some pretty sweet destruction physics and a fun concept, this game has a lot of potential, with the inclusion of an arsenal of weaponry, more cars, more customisation, and soft body physics or harsher destruction (the ability to bend, crush, and destroy parts of the car as well as the whole car.) this game could be a whole lot better, and while not finished, as stated before, it is a very fun game for an early access title.

My suggestions:

- Soft body physics / harsher destruction
- Vehicular upgrades, visual and performance
- Cleaner menus and UI
- Ability to change the resolution of the game
- Other stores as well as interactions (People, etc.)
- More vehicles overall
- Weapons for your character
- Possible character customisation

Overall, I recommend this game, but for a later date, add it to your wishlist and keep an eye on it. If you're feeling generous or experimental, send the devs some support by purchasing this game like myself! The past MadOut games are a few hours of fun and well made whereas this has a LOT more potential, especially with more features to come.

Keep it up MadOut team!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow, here's a welcome change to the MadOut series!  This Open City game is exactly as it sounds, it's wide open!  It's like MadOut GTA!  Except it's more technically flawed than the original MadOut games.  It needs a lot of work, but there is an Early Access banner which means we will get a lot of patches down the pipeline soon!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IGkCC7VjbwU

One thing I love about it is when you finish a race, the game doesn't need to load the open world again.  You go from a state of in-race" to "roaming the world" seamlessly.  In fact
date: you can just ignore the race and just go do your own thing at any time.  Also
hoursPlayed: the car parts that were smashed off of cars are still in the game world afterwards.  These are things every game should have!\n\nEverything right now is super impressive to me.  The flaws
voteText: though?  Well
helpfulPercent: you can't currently respawn properly.  If you get stuck
votesHelpful: you need to close the program and relaunch.  Also the 2nd race seemed to be bugged
votesTotal: I couldn't complete it.  You can get stuck in the ocean
votesFunny: I probably shouldn't go down there but there are giant ramps pointed into the ocean everywhere.\n\nLiterally all he needs is a button that will spawn the player back into the starting house.  And fix that second race
commentsCount: so I can continue to explore this game!"
